content.description: On the tall face of the splitter crack, sit start with hands on the right side of the crack. Figure out a way to gain the chimney, they squeeze your way up until you can grab holds on the lip for the top out.(not using the lower block to stand or sit on makes the top out a bit harder, and in my opinion more fun)
content.location: Tall face of the chimney/ split crack

content.description: Start sitting as far back under the roof as you can manage. Climb up the obvious feature with crimps and some hard tension moves before a big huck to a jug out the small roof. Top out the high slab.
content.location: Â Walk up the hill and follow the path right, it's just uphill from Courtney's boulder.

content.description: Take the undercling flake to the top utilizing mediocre feet and sharp jugs
content.location: The undercling flake on the Courtney's boulder

content.description: Start on the undercling flake and make moves out the lil roof left to some crimps and slopers and stuff.Probably needs a good scrubbing again.
content.location: Up the trail and hang a right. Level with the first tier of boulders, not quite in the talus.

content.description: Tall arete with some face holds for good measure. Starting on right high crimp and arete.
content.location: Towards the left end of the talus field. Same boulder as "passing the bar". If you miss this bloc you might be blind.

content.description: Beneath the crag of spice mountain lies a boulder field containing highballs, huge splitter cracks, and other cool features. This area has seemed to have fallen off the radar, and is currently seeing redevelopment from local climbers.  Strongly recommend bug spray!
